hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is

over your right hand side you'll see the

it that is steam accom /at x 20 to
report and you can play the interview
right on steam it let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now
when we think of the economy not just
here in the United States but globally
we need to remember something very
important this economy that were in it's
not a people's economy this was designed
by the central bank and there's no
reason to keep this economy going
there's no reason to repair it which it
can't but the whole purpose of what
we're seeing right now is to get rid of
the central bankers economy and the only
way to do that is to destroy it and
create an economy without the central
bank behind it because well the central
bank does is loan the people currency
with interest attached and where do they
get it out of thin air they push a
button that's it they do absolutely
nothing else they don't balance
everything they don't keep the economy
going if that is true we wouldn't have
all these crashes they be able to
forecast a recession there's no reason
to have a central bank we were tricked
into accepting them and this has
happened many many times before there's
no reason why we need an outside
corporation which is not part of the
people to loan us currency
they're just creating it out of thin air
it makes no sense whatsoever so keep
that in mind when we talk about the
economy and remember they know their
design only lasts 40 to 45 years at the
most
maybe they can keep it going a little
bit longer but eventually what happens
it all breaks down and remember we
started this new system back in the 70s
1971 it is now 2018 and here we are at
what 47 years or so so we're at that
point where this entire thing is going
to completely break down and implode now
they thought this was gonna happen a
while ago they were preparing for it and
they were going to use an event we
talked about this many many times before
and we need to understand that it is
impossible for this entire system to pay
down the debt to zero because think
about it in the very early stages when
they created the central bank and they
made that first dollar loan to the
government the government owed what $1
25 where do you get the 25 cents it
doesn't exist they can't do anything
except borrow more so there's always
gonna be more owed than dollars that are
out there it's completely impossible to
pay this down so when we look at this
economy we can see that it was meant and
it was designed to break apart after a
certain period of time because it wasn't
built to create a thriving economy where
the people flourish it was created to
make the upper echelon very very wealthy
to allow the central bank to keep
control over everything that's what it
was really designed for and they just
keep restarting it I mean after World
War two we went on to the central bank
system Bretton Woods 1971 petrodollar
system and now they want to bring us to
the next system this has been the plan
for a very long time
and what we're seeing is that retail
stores they have completely imploded on
themselves now a lot of people say well
it's online sales everything's moving to
online sales but we're already seeing
signs that online sales well they're
starting to slow best buy report it a
drop in quarterly online sales growth
they're afraid that online sales have
hit a peak at this time eventually
everything will hit a peak and what
happens is all these stores they have
online presence and it doesn't mean that
everyone's saying hey you know something
I'm not going to shop in the brick and
mortar I'm gonna go to their online
store and buy there everyone is not
running to Amazon to purchase everything
from Amazon this is a trillion dollar
industry and it's not a 1:1 ratio where
everything is moving to online so what
we're seeing right now is that Best Buy
said in a statement that domestic online
sales rose 10.1 percent in its second
quarter ending August 1st that compares
with 12% in the first quarter and what
they're seeing is that people are
starting to move away from online and
from brick-and-mortar at the same time
because what happens when an economy
breaks down well your extra spending
money completely disappears because you
don't have that high paying job you have
a part-time job a lot of people are out
of the market right now because they
can't find work this has been going on
for a very long time and all they do is
manipulate the numbers to make you think
that everything is fantastic if you look
at home sales right now we know that
existing new home sales they have
declined we see mortgage applications
they are dropping and now pending home
sales they missed expectations dropping
0.7% month on month so now we have
existing new home and pending sales all
falling now pending home sales they have
declined for the seventh straight month
in a row now think about what's
happening here we have all these
different indicators telling us that
home sales are declining now this is
during a period where home sales are
supposed to be very very strong this is
the spring summer months we are heading
into the fall
winter months where real estate starts
to slow now in September the Fed is
looking to raise interest rates once
again if they do this guess what's gonna

what's going to happen to new home
existing home pending home sales they're
all going to decline further and if we
look at the sentiment for home buying we
see that it's the worst since Lehman
this is not going to improve and what is
happening here is this economy is
imploding on itself now while all this
is happening
Trump is pushing that this economy is

retail still declining online sales

yes there's still channel stuffing and

they really didn't change much the only

companies

people are realizing that we've been

why do we see all of these countries in

interest is a good thing and if you look

what do we see we see everyone drowning

you just keep rolling it over to the

never-ending you see mortgages
everyone's drowning in mortgages
everything there's interest attached
with everything the central bankers plan

because when the value of the dollar
decreases and you need more dollars to

to pay for that home and the wages don't

can't afford anything and the only thing
that you can do is take out loans just
think back over time when you take a
look at the entire economic system when
you go back to 1913
people didn't need credit cards back
then people were able to purchase their
cars people were able to purchase their
food with cash people were able to
purchase everything as time went on and
the value of the dollar decreased you we
needed more and more credit now
fast-forward to 1970 when we came off

balances were off the gold standard the
central bank can create currency by
pushing a button and the government's
are able to borrow as much as they want
well that value of that dollar decreases
if it decreases you need a lot more of

don't notice it you don't notice

yet the 80s they haven't dropped the

everything started to even out and all

people taking out more loans to do
things borrowing because they told us it

more homes uh prices on homes moved up
college tuition moved up food was

we saw that we couldn't afford anything
I can't go out and purchase a car yes it
first started out I had to finance it

two months now people can't even finance

just never ends because the value of the

gone past 30 years because people

so you had to take more and more out
there system is designed not to make you

those people that are in it now are
